predicate.note: Frames file for 'bleed' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

roleset.name: to emit or lose blood, to be wounded

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Prior to his term , a teacher bled to death in the halls , [*-1] stabbed [*-2] by a student .

example.name: with predication
example.text: This wage inflation is bleeding the NFL dry , the owners contend [*T*-1] .

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: The humor of the story owes much to the fact that no hearts ( even the characters ' own ) are likely [*-1] to bleed for the plight of health-food eaters .
example.arg: [*-1] -> no hearts ( even the characters ' own )

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: Mr. Keating is currently the subject of a $1.1 billion federal anti-racketeering lawsuit accusing him of [*] bleeding off assets of a California thrift he controlled, Lincoln Savings & Loan Association, and driving it into insolvency.
example.arg: assets of a California thrift he controlled, Lincoln Savings & Loan Association,
